title: bestcandy
author: bestcandy
content: Before Donald Trump was inauguration as the 47th president of US we were all optimistic to experience more bull run of Bitcoin considering all his proposed plans which seen to be favourable to Bitcoin but what we are seeing now in the price of Bitcoin is opposite of what we were expecting.Before he was inuagurated there was a bullish in the price of Bitcoin to about $100k but Bitcoin has dipped to about $97k. Because of Trump position in Bitcoin people are considering the current dip to be as a result of Trump signed executive order that imposed 25% tariff on imports from Mexico and Canada and 10% from China.https://www.forbes.com/sites/alisondurkee/2025/02/01/trump-signs-new-tariffs-on-canada-mexico-and-china-heres-what-to-know/

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: bestcandy on February 03, 2025, 02:02:48 AMBefore Donald Trump was inauguration as the 47th president of US we were all optimistic to experience more bull run of Bitcoin considering all his proposed plans which seen to be favourable to Bitcoin but what we are seeing now in the price of Bitcoin is opposite of what we were expecting.Before he was inuagurated there was a bullish in the price of Bitcoin to about $100k but Bitcoin has dipped to about $97k. Because of Trump position in Bitcoin people are considering the current dip to be as a result of Trump signed executive order that imposed 25% tariff on imports from Mexico and Canada and 10% from China.https://www.forbes.com/sites/alisondurkee/2025/02/01/trump-signs-new-tariffs-on-canada-mexico-and-china-heres-what-to-know/Global economic and political conditions usually affect the price of Bitcoin. Therefore, it is possible that the tariff war is the cause of the drop in price. Trump has made some favorable promises to the crypto industry, and he has fulfilled some like the release Ross Ulbricht. He has also set up cryptocurrency working group tasked with proposing new digital asset regulations and exploring the creation of a national cryptocurrency stockpile. It is important to note that Bitcoin doesn't depend on any politician to achieve its objectives. We are in the bull run; hence the price could get to any level. Don't depend on politicians to make your investment decisions because they cannot be trusted.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: bestcandy on February 03, 2025, 02:02:48 AMBefore Donald Trump was inauguration as the 47th president of US we were all optimistic to experience more bull run of Bitcoin considering all his proposed plans which seen to be favourable to Bitcoin but what we are seeing now in the price of Bitcoin is opposite of what we were expecting.Before he was inuagurated there was a bullish in the price of Bitcoin to about $100k but Bitcoin has dipped to about $97k. Because of Trump position in Bitcoin people are considering the current dip to be as a result of Trump signed executive order that imposed 25% tariff on imports from Mexico and Canada and 10% from China.It's "Buy the rumors, sell the news". The saying goes like this and we are witnessing how it works in the market.Expectation on Trump effects shown months ago on the market, fear about his tariff and trade wars with many nations appeared months ago but now it is coming back. Positive expectation did not come back recently but fear did come back and triggered the market crash.Bitcoin will recover, and it will continue its bullish growth in adoption and price. Trump will only be one piece in Bitcoin history, don't mind about him if you invest in bitcoin very long term.You need to know and focus on this HODL map than on Trump.https://hodl.camp/

comments.author: ranochigo
comments.body: Trumps policies are for Americans, not for Bitcoin. Bitcoin is secondary in the grand scheme of things, and the bigger players in crypto are also by his side. I'm more optimistic about Trump to Bitcoin, so far, than the rest.Tariffs won't work to his advantage, at least not when he's directly attacking his closest allies. Don't confuse tariffs with his crypto policies, and the entire stock market is reacting negatively to it anyways so there isn't much value in correlating them.

comments.author: kentrolla
comments.body: There can never be a single factor or individual responsible for pump or dump of bitcoin as Bitcoin is way too bigger than these individuals or groups hence I don't think there was any impact on Bitcoin due to Trump and if that was the case we wouldn't have seen Bitcoin dropping down. To $94k today Trump is a joke as one day he will say he support bitcoin and other day he would say he don't. He is a businessman and will take calls depending on what's best for his business.

comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: Quote from: bestcandy on February 03, 2025, 02:02:48 AMBefore he was inuagurated there was a bullish in the price of Bitcoin to about $100k but Bitcoin has dipped to about $97k.  Not every price movement can be credited back to Trump. The world is huge. There are other countries that may also affect bitcoin. Or maybe sometimes whatever the governments are doing do not have an impact on bitcoin market. Sometimes it’s all just because of the investors QuoteBecause of Trump position in Bitcoin people are considering the current dip to be as a result of Trump signed executive order that imposed 25% tariff on imports from Mexico and Canada and 10% from China.We need to stop thinking every single thing Trump does is for bitcoin. Sometimes even political and economic decisions would not directly affect bitcoin. Stop depending on Trump to make decisions about your bitcoins.

comments.author: ekstremista
comments.body: Trump's pro-crypto stance has certainly been a positive. Perhaps most importantly, he replaced the SEC's anti-crypto leadership with better people. This seems to be a bit under-appreciated -- e.g., banks no longer need to consider bitcoin a liability or a "pariah" holding, but are free to create crypto products on par with mainstream securities.Unfortunately, all that was so 3 days ago. Short-term markets have a short attention span and forget easily. Tariffs are the new bugbear. Ergo, the weekend dump we've been enjoying. But the long term is the long term.

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: I would like to quote what I read a few days ago in Bitcoin Magazine,People are less concerned with the creeping web of business relationships in the mining ecosystem, which is the bedrock of Bitcoin’s foundation of openness and censorship resistance, and more concerned with whether President Trump is going to just pump our bags, or pump the bags of shit-coiners too.We are counting our chickens before they hatched.You can read more here: https://bitcoinmagazine.com/takes/bitcoin-what-went-wrong

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: bestcandy on February 03, 2025, 02:02:48 AMBefore Donald Trump was inauguration as the 47th president of US we were all optimistic to experience more bull run of Bitcoin considering all his proposed plans which seen to be favourable to Bitcoin but what we are seeing now in the price of Bitcoin is opposite of what we were expecting.Before he was inuagurated there was a bullish in the price of Bitcoin to about $100k but Bitcoin has dipped to about $97k. Because of Trump position in Bitcoin people are considering the current dip to be as a result of Trump signed executive order that imposed 25% tariff on imports from Mexico and Canada and 10% from China.https://www.forbes.com/sites/alisondurkee/2025/02/01/trump-signs-new-tariffs-on-canada-mexico-and-china-heres-what-to-know/I wouldn't care about the price changes to be honest! We have seen so many such declines earlier as well so I am not worried about it. But if you ask if Trump is a positive influence or not, I think it's too early to come to a conclusion. There's a lot that needs to be done about cryptos in US. Unless the crypto companies can do their businesses without fearing the regulatory authorities, nothing will change! So trump has a lot to deliver. I came to know that one country in Latin America, El-Salvador has announced that Bitcoin is not anymore a legal tender there. It seems they need a loan of 1.4 Billion USD from IMF and IMF told them to reduce their crypto related activities to be able to get the loan. US is the largest financial contributor to IMF. So it's contradictory and confusing. I think we will have to see for some more time.

comments.author: jcojci
comments.body: After Trump show, Bitcoin is down a lot and many people not expect to see this dip. But this dip can continue because some analyst predict that Bitcoin price can down to $75k. If that is happen, maybe some people will panic and don't know what they need to do.I don't think too much about Trump because he can do many things after he becomes a President. He can change his plan anytime so we cannot still expecting him to be like before so that is why we must be ready for anything that can happen. We must make a back up plan to face any scenario that can happen.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: I think he is. It started with his campaign and continued into the actual electoral process, counting up to this point of being elected. Remember that it was during the counting when we reached the milestone and historical near high of $100k until it pushed to that set price of many holders. While Bitcoin alone isn't reliant on his policies and whatever he says since this is a different market. But we can't deny that the fundamentals and development with his foreign policies pushes or pulls the institutions to do what they think is right related to Bitcoin holding.

comments.body: Quote from: jcojci on February 03, 2025, 06:20:19 AMAfter Trump show, Bitcoin is down a lot and many people not expect to see this dip. But this dip can continue because some analyst predict that Bitcoin price can down to $75k. If that is happen, maybe some people will panic and don't know what they need to do.Bitcoin is not dependent on Trump and it will not move according to anyone's predictions, just because experts predict that it could drop to $75k does not mean that it will definitely happen.Quote from: jcojci on February 03, 2025, 06:20:19 AMI don't think too much about Trump because he can do many things after he becomes a President. He can change his plan anytime so we cannot still expecting him to be like before so that is why we must be ready for anything that can happen. We must make a back up plan to face any scenario that can happen.We need to realize that what he can do is create a friendly environment for bitcoin and the crypto industry to grow, not bring about a bull market because he doesn't have the power or ability to do that. The bull market is driven by many factors, Trump is not the only one and just because Trump is bullish on Bitcoin does not mean the price will always rise. Bitcoin is part of the economy and it will be affected by the economy more than any other factor. So expecting Trump to boost bitcoin prices is just a delusion of Trump fans.

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: Quote from: bestcandy on February 03, 2025, 02:02:48 AMBefore Donald Trump was inauguration as the 47th president of US we were all optimistic to experience more bull run of Bitcoin considering all his proposed plans which seen to be favourable to Bitcoin but what we are seeing now in the price of Bitcoin is opposite of what we were expecting.Before he was inuagurated there was a bullish in the price of Bitcoin to about $100k but Bitcoin has dipped to about $97k. Because of Trump position in Bitcoin people are considering the current dip to be as a result of Trump signed executive order that imposed 25% tariff on imports from Mexico and Canada and 10% from China.https://www.forbes.com/sites/alisondurkee/2025/02/01/trump-signs-new-tariffs-on-canada-mexico-and-china-heres-what-to-know/LOL, Trump is barely a month in the office and so we still need to se what he can do to Bitcoin and not readily judging him like once he will take his oath, the US Bitcoin strategic reserves will be implement and then we will see a parabolic rise.We are still in the bullish cycle though just remember that. But it doesn't mean that the price will go up all throughout the year. Regardless if he is elected or not, Bitcoin's price will go up because we are in a cycle, unless that cycle has been broken already. However, that is not the case, so even if we see the price going below 6 digits again, you shouldn't doubt that the market will recover and bounce back and we might hit what all the predictions in this bull run, which is around $150,000-$180,000 top price.

comments.author: criptoevangelista
comments.body: It's part of the game, any macroeconomic movement moves the market, even more so on a weekend when volume drops and manipulation becomes easier, these robust drops usually recover in a few days, see this as an opportunity to buy cheaper... and another thing, we are in a bull run, but the market moves in waves, so it's normal. The important thing in all of this is to HODL and let time work

comments.author: Nothingtodo
comments.body: Just as Bitcoin pumps the market when it receives a positive announcement, it also dumps the market when it receives a negative announcement. The market had risen a lot due to Donald Trump's positive outlook on Bitcoin, but now the market is trending downward again. However, Donald Trump is very sensitive to Bitcoin, so if the market goes down at any time, it will not take long for the market to recover or correct.

comments.author: Felicity_Tide
comments.body: Did Trump ever promised us that he will impact or make the price of Bitcoin pump hard?, No I don't think so, and I can't remember reading anything like that incase he did. From what I know, his stance and support for Bitcoin before and during the election triggered the whole $100K thing, which is clearly how the market works, News and rumors.But, I'm not really sure of what actually caused the recent dip. If it was actually caused by the "Trump signed executive order that imposes 25% tariff on imports from Mexico and Canada and 10% from China" as you've stated, then I don't think it was intentionally imposed to make Bitcoin dip. Just like ranochigo had, "Trumps policies are for Americans,  not for Bitcoin". Whatever orders Trump imposes is only meant to favor the people of America, and it doesn't matter if it affects others or not. It's quite unfortunate that Bitcoin and the crypto market is on the receiving end of his policies this time. I think those who had less expectations from him won't be surprise at all.

Please understand the nature of Bitcoin it will help you not to follow all the news online that can mislead you into selling off your Bitcoin. Trump has kept his promises since he entered seat. Those that are needed to be enacted immediately has started. With time Bitcoin will reach the level we want just hold and stay patient. Trump cannot manipulate the market even if he is the President of the Bitcoin nation.

comments.author: Lamkuthang
comments.body: All of this is inseparable from the state agenda and it has been scheduled. I think there are many things that have made the market not rise because tomorrow there will be another event related to the FED-US Economic Outlock and bank regulation policies.That is why the market is still not comfortable for us to see because those who have large capital also need supporting data so that their investment decisions do not make the wrong move.

comments.author: mirakal
comments.body: I could not say that Trump is the best for bitcoin but indeed Trump creates a positive impact for bitcoin. I don’t think we will reach the current price this fast if not for Trump, although we can also say that volatility hits huge for bitcoin and that made it reached its new all time high. However, one thing I realized upon seeing the actions and decisions of Trump right now, bitcoin isn’t his priority but it’s still USD. But the fact that he still promotes bitcoin in a positive way and becomes more open about cryptocurrency, that could be a good sign that this could pave way for a faster global adoption for bitcoin.
